link.title: Lenoir City Schools: News and Announcements

div.aria-label: Lenoir City Schools Instructional Plan for COVID-19 News Post
div.h3: Lenoir City Schools Instructional Plan for COVID-19
div.p: Lenoir City Schools administrators have worked to create an instructional plan for students during the COVID-19 closing. The district plan is posted at the provided link. Each principal will be communicating the school specific plan as developed by teachers for each grade level and classes. To access the information please click on the title.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Lenoir City Schools followed the Governor’s urging to close school in an effort to reduce the spread of the COVID-19 virus. At this time, our schools will be closed until April 3, 2020. We continue to seek and receive guidance daily from the state department of education during this ongoing crisis.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: The goal for academics and daily instruction during this period will be to review previously-covered material, practice skills, and advanced organizers to maintain learning as best we can in all grade levels, while ensuring the safety of our students and faculty. While school-specific guidelines will be communicated by each principal, as a district,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: priority will be placed on core content and seniors preparing for graduation.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: We will utilize the district’s 1:1 technology (Chrome books in grades 4-12 currently in student possession), accompanying instructional resources, and teacher guidance in providing for continuation of learning during this time.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Any student who is currently participating in an online or dual enrollment class should continue to follow program requirements for credit.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Resources recommended for academic activities are accessible via free online applications/programs or the district’s Classlink single sign-on. Schools will utilize the Skylert system, email, Canvas, Remind, school websites and other school-specific communication tools to ensure clear messaging and support for parents and students.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: School administrators will ensure teachers communicate with parents & students to recommend academic activities with the intent to support continuation of learning in each grade level/subject area.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Parents, students, and teachers should check their email DAILY.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Specific questions should be directed via email to your school’s principal:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Lenoir City Intermediate/Middle School, Brandee Hoglund:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Lenoir City High School, Chip Orr:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: If you do not have a device at home, or reliable internet access, we encourage you to read with your child, review math facts, and take advantage of the learning opportunities that this situation provides.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-left: 11pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Spectrum is offering free broadband and WiFi internet access to students impacted by the coronavirus shutdown.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-left: 11pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: that beginning March 16, it will make its services available for free for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students who don’t already have internet through the company.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Corbel, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-left: 11pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: To enroll in the program, call 1-844-488-8395. Installation fees will be waived for new student households.
